course_title: Clinical Skills in Psychotherapy 1:  Engagement, Diagnosis, Formulation & Treatment Planning

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge and skills to engage with consumers to collaboratively address their mental health needs
Demonstrate knowledge and skills to use industry standard assessment, formulation and treatment planning approaches
Demonstrate knowledge and skills to use evidenced-based psychotherapeutic approaches to assessment, diagnosis and treatment planning.

assessments.assessment_title: Quiz: Mental Health Assessment and Therapeutic Alliance
assessments.task_description:
Students will undertake a quiz (quantitative and qualitative) during the residential workshop week regarding Mental Health Assessment and Therapeutic Alliance. The information assessed will directly correlate to content delivered during the workshop day on Thursday 12th March, 2026.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. Student demonstrates understanding and knowledge of the essential components, purpose and structure of a standard mental health assessment
  2. Student demonstrates knowledge of core therapeutic alliance components and the clinician’s role within collaborative mental health practice
  3. Student demonstrates the ability to reflect critically on their developing clinical practice in relation to workshop content
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quiz will be undertaken in exam conditions with course coordinator during the residential workshop week.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Please refer to the UQ policy on late submission.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Case Report: Standard Mental Health Approach
assessments.task_description:
Case report that presents a vivid portrait of your work with a client in a MH setting. It should describe the findings of your assessment, formulation and treatment planning. Where appropriate, you should report on the process of the work you have done together and your understanding of the outcome or current state of the work. This is a formal report using a format that is appropriate to your work environment. It should demonstrate developing competence in assessment, formulation, collaborative treatment planning. 1500 words 40%.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. The report describes the assessment, formulation and treatment planning that was done in collaboration with the client and, as appropriate, the report describes the process of any ongoing work and articulates changes you have made to your initial assessment.
  2. The report demonstrates developing competence in assessment, formulation, collaborative treatment planning
  3. Student has submitted a report that describes a mental health assessment process with a client. It is around 1500 words (+/- 10%) and is in formal report, appropriate to the work environment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Please refer to the UQ policy on late submission.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Case Conference Simulation: Student Oral Presentation
assessments.due_date:
21/05/2026 - 28/05/2026

Student presentations will occur during standard tutorial time. There is a possibility that the tutorial time may be extended, depending on number of student presentations to be completed across the 2 weeks. Student presentations are recorded for marking purposes only.
assessments.task_description:
Students are to present a (de-identified) thoughtful 10 - 15 minute specialist case formulation of their work with a client or family in their workplace. The P's formulation model should be utilised, incorporating one of the psychotherapy approaches studied in the course i.e. psychoanalytic, cognitive, behavioural, and systemic. A preliminary treatment plan and brief rationale should be presented. Students must engage in a 5-10 minute Q&A time after their presentation to further engage in clarification of content or answer any questions, simulating a case conference environment in a public mental health setting. Student presentations are recorded for marking purposes only. 40%.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. Student presentation that describes the assessment of an individual or family, appropriate to a work environment with the intention of simulating a case conference presentation and treatment progress update.
  2. As appropriate, the presentation describes the psychotherapy focussed assessment, formulation and treatment planning that was done in collaboration with the client/s.
  3. The presentation along with Q&A component clearly demonstrates developing competence in psychotherapy assessment, formulation, collaborative treatment planning.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via Turnitin on Learn.UQ (Blackboard) of transcript of formulation.
